intro: Cleome applanata, commonly known as the flatleaf cleome, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant belongs to the Cleomaceae family, which is also known as the "mouse-ear" family, and is distinguished by its unique floral structure. Cleome applanata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant flowers and ease of growth in well-drained soil. It thrives in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
